meanings.definition: To give up a claim or right
meanings.sent1: She remised her ownership of the toy to her little brother.
meanings.sent2: The tenant remised their request for a rent reduction.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel remised its hold on the nut, allowing the bird to snatch it away.
meanings.sent4: After much deliberation, he finally remised his dream of becoming a professional athlete.
meanings.sent5: The decision to remise his share of the inheritance was a difficult one for him.

meanings.definition: To place in a new position
meanings.sent1: The librarian remised the book on the top shelf for safekeeping.
meanings.sent2: She remised the vase on the mantelpiece to showcase its beauty.
meanings.sent3: The chef remised the garnish on top of the dish, adding a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent4: The interior designer remised the painting in the center of the room to create a focal point.
meanings.sent5: He carefully remised the trophy on the display shelf, ensuring it was prominently featured.

meanings.definition: To put back in a previous position
meanings.sent1: He remised the chair to its original place after the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The janitor remised the trash can to its designated spot in the hallway.
meanings.sent3: The child remised the puzzle pieces to their correct positions on the board.
meanings.sent4: She quickly remised the misplaced keys to their rightful hook by the door.
meanings.sent5: The gardener remised the plant to its sunny spot by the window for optimal growth.
